items.title: Fintech player Pine Labs kicks off international roadshows, targets IPO launch after Diwali
items.description: The fintech player is contemplating a post-Diwali window to launch the IPO, targetting late October or early November for the offer, sources said, contingent to regulator Sebi’s approval and prevailing market conditions.

items.title: IPO-bound Curefoods plans ambitious brand expansion, to invest Rs 152 cr for setting up new kitchens and outlets by 2029
items.description: The Curefoods IPO is expected to hit the markets before the end of the calendar year, sources said, and the foodtech player's expansion will be supported by a blend of organic growth, acquisitions and investment in infrastructure.

items.title: Shringar House of Mangalsutra Limited IPO: Will it shine on the bourses?
items.description: The fund raise via IPO will help SHOML tap new clients and significantly scale up the business

items.title: Urban Company IPO: Can a sticky business model offset thin profits?
items.description: For long-term investors, the flotation offers a differentiated way to participate in the formalisation of India’s home-services market

items.title: OPINION | Mo Money, Mo Problems (and fewer customers)—Why conglomerates struggle with digital commerce
items.description: Conglomerates struggle in Indian e-commerce due to slower decision-making and lack of cultural relevance. Success lies in leveraging existing strengths—supply chains, partnerships, and trust—rather than mimicking startups

items.title: OPINION | The growing importance of skills in shaping employability
items.description: In India's evolving job market, employers are prioritising practical skills over academic qualifications. Skill-based hiring, online certifications, and vocational training are reshaping career paths, driving innovation and economic progress
